152.title: Myrtle
152.author: by Dudley Fisher
152.series: July 25, 1944) "I Ought to Be a Pro and Give Lessons!"*
152.appears_in: reproduced on p. 81 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Myrtle's pop gives her a golf lesson, and is impressed at the results.

153.title: Myrtle
153.author: Dudley Fisher.
153.series: Mar. 21, 1950) "Let's Play We're Little Puppies and Eat Right Off the Plate"*
notes: Summary: The real dogs steal their peanut butter sandwiches.

154.title: Myrtle
154.author: Dudley Fisher.
154.series: May 10, 1950) "You Padded the Wrong Side of the Paddle"*
notes: Summary: Myrtle gets the ping-pong paddle softened, but the spanking still hurts.

155.title: Myrtle
155.author: Dudley Fisher.
155.series: June 1, 1950) "By the Time Eddie Gets Over the Measles the Darn Grass will Need Cutting Again!"*
notes: Summary: Samson's mad. He mowed the lawn to get permission to go to Eddie's party, then Eddie got sick.

156.title: Myrtle
156.author: Dudley Fisher.
156.series: Feb. 15, 1951) "Why Don't YOU Run Up to the Grocery?"*
notes: Summary: Myrtle's mom says Myrtle has to go to the grocery story, and since Myrtle's dad says he runs things at their house, Sampson doesn't understand.

157.title: Myrtle
157.author: Dudley Fisher.
157.series: Feb. 16, 1951) "Take Your Time, Myrtle, the Teacher Isn't Here Yet!"*
notes: Summary: Myrtle worries about being late for school.
